citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under sections 9A and 52A of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 –

        (a) declare the intended new line of the Colebrook Main Road to be the line specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation; and
        (b) immediately upon the declaration specified in paragraph (a) taking effect, revoke the part of the proclamation made under section 9A of that Act that was notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1989, No. 111; and
        (c) declare the part of the Colebrook Main Road specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be a limited access road; and
        (d) declare the places of access for the purposes of section 52B of that Act to be the places of access specified in Schedule 2 to this proclamation; and
        (e) immediately upon the declarations specified in paragraphs (c) and (d) taking effect, revoke the part of the proclamation made under section 52A of that Act that was notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1989, No. 111.
16 September 2013

PETER G. UNDERWOOD

Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

D. J. O'BYRNE

Minister for Infrastructure

SCHEDULE 1 - Intended New Line of the Colebrook Main Road

Name  Description  Length in kilometres  Colebrook Main Road  From a point approximately 95 metres south-west of the existing Colebrook Main Road junction with Middle Tea Tree Road, Richmond to a point approximately 400 metres north of the existing Colebrook Main Road junction with Victoria Street, Richmond, as shown bounded by heavy black lines on Plan No. 9644 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 3 to this proclamation  1.36
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    


SCHEDULE 2 - Places of Access

                   Location                                                                                                                                                    
Item  Description                                                                              1.  Middle Tea Tree Road – west side  0.08  2.  Colebrook Road – east side  1.17
                   (distance in kilometres from point of commencement of limited access road)                                                                                  
                                                                                                                                                                               


SCHEDULE 3 - Plan

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 25 September 2013

This proclamation is administered in the Department of Infrastructure, Energy and Resources.
